articles.content: A study led by the University of Cambridge suggests that the cooling effect of volcanic eruptions on Earths surface temperature is likely underestimated in standard climate projections, possibly by u… [+5443 chars]

articles.author: Zach Clark
articles.title: NASA's Juno Mission Observes High-Altitude Hazes in Jupiter's Atmosphere - SpaceCoastDaily.com
articles.description: As the spacecraft flew low over the giant planet's cloud tops, its JunoCam instrument captured this look at bands of high-altitude haze forming above cyclones in an area known at Jet N7.
articles.content:
By Space Coast Daily  //  June 25, 2023 
At the time the image was taken, Juno was about 5,095 miles (8,200 kilometers) above Jupiter’s cloud tops, at a latitude of about 66 degrees. (NASA Image)

articles.title: Move over polyester, make way for spider silk – DW – 06/17/2023 - DW (English)
articles.description: Spider silk is completely biodegradable, yet incredibly durable. For more than 20 years, scientists have been looking for a way to make spider silk on an industrial scale. And it appears they've finally found it.
